result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael C Barbano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael C Barbano is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael C Barbano was found guilty of Possession of THC (Ordinance Violation). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael C Barbano

records.addlTxt:
[MK; Court Reporter-Mary Heederik] 
case called at 10:25am.
Defendant Michael C Barbano in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Barbano provides documentation to ADA Teuber that verifies that he has completed the group dynamics class. 
On Motion of ADA Teuber and the agreement of Mr. Barbano, the Court amends Count #1 to Possession of THC in violation of Jefferson County Ordinance 9.11 
Mr. Barbano pleads "Guilty" to the amended charge.
The Court receives the plea and orders Judgment entered. 
The Court orders payment of a forfeiture of $25 plus costs = $236. The Court grants Mr. Barbano sixty days to pay the amount in full. Non-payment will result in a one year drivers license suspension.
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses Count #2 outright.
recess 10:32am
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 2:22 PM 
Defendant Michael C Barbano in court.   Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews the court record. 

Mr. Barbano indicates that he is enrolled in class contemplated in resolution.
DA Hall has no objection to setting status after anticipated completion of class.

recess:2:25pm 
NEXT: Status on 10/21/22 at 10:00am

Defendant Michael C Barbano in court.   Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews court record.

ADA Shock requests a pretrial and status be scheduled, to allow assigned prosecutor to speak with Mr. Barbano.

recess: 11:00am

Status conference on April 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia

[ae] case called 08:37 AM Defendant Michael C Barbano in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct and provides mailing address.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered; speedy trial waived 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
